answers.answer: Yep, I'm in the same situation. Turns out if you're over 20 weeks it's extremely hard to find an OB.

Also, I've only gained 1lb and he doesn't seem to care at all. And I have sciatica and residual pain from my epidural with my son. I care for him by myself all day and he's 11 months old. Sometimes I can't even walk and tylenol doesn't do anything. He wont refer me to a cyropractor (sp?) or anything.
It *****! I don't understand why they wont accept me. My baby needs care no matter how far along I am!!
What?? That is really ****** up. I've never even heard of anything like that.

My doctor(s) are really neglectful too. They'll run tests on me and prescribe me medicine(without telling me) or they'll forget to write stuff in my file and I'll have to ask them specifically if I have a UTI and they'll be like "umm...oh yeah I see that you do have one". I've been trying to switch for a few weeks now, and as soon as I get my records to the new potential doctor, they won't take me because I'm so high risk and over 20 weeks.
Wow. I would be pissed. Surely there is a doctor somewhere who will... Even if you have to fib a little bout how far along you are, ect.
Me either. I had no idea they could deny me because of how far along I am or I would have switched sooner.

I can't lie about how far I am because they require my records from my other Dr before they'll see me. Idk how well that'll work cause he never writes anything down. He puts it all in his iPad. I don't have a chart or file at all.
Wow seriously???....just no.

@acline idk if I'm high risk or not seeing as they've never tested me for anything. I had preeclampsia with my son so I thought for sure he'd at least do a urine sample regularly.Oh and the prescription thing? Yeah, he wont even do anything a tiny bit stronger than tylenol and the prick gave my cousin percocet and saboxin during her pregnancy because she was addicted when she got pregnant. I'm against prescription narcodics, but if he can give her something that strong, he can give me ibuprofen.
that's screwed up. they should at least have you on a baby aspirin regimen since you had preeclampsia with your last pregnancy.
That's what I thought, too. I had to be induced with my son because my BP was so high.

Sounds horrible... Ill let you know that is it okay to go 5 or 6 weeks at this point without seeing a doctor. Also for your sciatica pain I have that real bad and stronger pain meds dont help! If you go online there is a bunch of stretches you can do and believe me they help! Dont take Ibuprofen it is not safe for the baby! Good luck and I hope you feel better!
Omg that's horrible I have never heard of it were do u live?? I'm in process of trying switch bcuz mine pissed me off last time I'm 19+4

I haven't taken anything my doctor didn't prescribe, but in my opinion, percocet and saboxin are worse than ibuprofen. I've done the stretches and massages cause I've had it since I was 10 weeks with my 11 month old. I could handle that by itself. Its the lower back pain. Not even sure if it's from my epidural seeing as my doctor completely ignores it. Its from one hip to the other and from the middle of my back to the top of my butt. Been constant for 7 weeks now.
I'm in Louisiana.
I changed my ob at 25 weeks I had to call a few doctors but I found one to take me I felt like my ob didn't care or explain anything

Are u on medicad? If so u have to call the number om your card and say your not satisfied. pick a obgyn in your area and call and let them no u want them as a obgyn. When ur new card comes in u cam go. You go to your new ob office and sign a paper to transfer records. The other office will fax them over and u can be seen.
Yup, I would switch. I changed doctors at 15 weeks for this exact same reason almost. And my new doctor is wonderful! I'm now 28 weeks and so glad I switched.
I did my transfer by the books but I've been referred to 4 drs through Medicaid and have been denied by all of them so far.

The only thing u can do is call the doctors in the book ahead of time and ask if they are taking new mefovaid patients. Whem u finally get a yes call the number on the book and ask for that exact obgyn.
I did that already. They accept new patients, but not transfers after 20 weeks.
That is nuts & doesn't make sense are there clinics available that have ob's?? I jus switched mine a few mins ago I explained wat is happening & they said they understand

question: I'm 24+3 and it's so hard to find a doctor that will accept me this far along! My other doctor didn't do urine tests, blood tests or even a glucose test. They're done at 24 weeks in my state.He's half an hour from me and my car is broke down so I had to borrow my MIL's car for my appointment. I get there just to find out he was called away to a meeting. I hadn't been seen in over 5 weeks because he was on vacation for 2 weeks. Every time I call, he's unavailable and the nurses leave the phone on the answering service sometimes a whole hour after they're open. They said they'd tried to call but I never got a call, nor did my husband or MIL and they have all 3 numbers.Ugh!! Sorry for the rant.
title: transfer OBGYN
